system.biography:
TitleFFF 801b Gargu-Hyeka King
Birthday25 Larane 708
AppearanceAge 11, height 42, medium frame (size 4), weight 95 lb, pallid complexion, ugly appearance, brown hair, brown eyes.
Medical/PsycheAsthma (double fatigue penalties), Sex mania (test against WIL3 or carry out sadistic rape at earliest opportunity)
Size0
ArmorChain byrnie, plate halfhelm, plate vambraces, cloth tunic and leggings, and shield. Mang.
Other EquipmentNone
Valuables42d in coins
Notes

Biography

The gargun of the Sorkin Mountains that border the Kathela Hills have a love/hate relationship with the indigenous Kath, meaning they love to hate their human neighbors.

Kaeucks colony makes frequent raids to despoil Kath camps and capture prisoners. Those Kath taken alive quickly envy the dead when Kaeuck and his warriors start their sport. A prisoner who dies early in the orgy of raping, killing, and eating (not necessary in that order) is deemed fortunate indeed by those who otherwise suffer unimaginably before they meet their end. One of Kaeucks favorite entertainments involves seeing how long it takes a prisoner to die when a sharpened roasting spit is slowly pushed up through the anus and out the mouth. He decorates himself with totems of human hair and hands taken from prisoners he has personally sported with.

Kaeuck took the kingship of his colony when he buried his mankar in the kings head while the king was in congress with the queen. It is a testament to Kaeucks craftiness that he was able to bribe the guards of the queens chamber. He has since held the kingship for a solid year and seems likely to hold it for a few more while he keeps his warriors busy raiding their human neighbors rather than idling and spending time plotting his demise.

Kaeucks constant warfare with the Kath recently reached a peak when his warriors ambushed a hunting party and carried away Kesta, the beautiful and greatly beloved daughter of a powerful Kath chieftan, Paewe. A band of Kath warriors was sent to rescue Kesta but many moons have passed and they have not returned. Paewe has sworn to retrieve his daughter no matter the cost.

HOOKS

Kill! Rape! Destroy! The PCs are encamped in Kathela when Kaeuck and his band set upon them in the dead of night. The gargun king is looking to add to the hives larder and have a little evenings entertainment.

For the Love of a Daughter. Paewe has finished mourning for his daughter and now seeks bloody vengeance. Such is his anger that he is willing to put his tribe at risk from the evil influences of the Kaldoric warriors he seeks to hire to fight the mountain demons. A tribesman offers the PCs anything they wish for their aid.

A Pound of Flesh. The PCs are hired by a wealthy mercantyler who managed to survive a brutal attack by Kaeuck. The merchant escaped, but with the loss of his hands and his sanity, and his thoughts have become consumed with vengeance. He is willing to spend his entire clan fortune to see Kaeuck dead.

Credits

This character is taken from Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13 on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is fanon, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
